timeline.bodyText: Just a note here. You shouldn't need to import the ConfigurationManager, as this class already has access to the ConfigurationService.  The ConfigurationManager is deprecated in favor of the ConfigurationService.  So, you should remove this import and just use configurationService instead.
timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText:
A small comment.  You don't need to do all this string parsing of shibURL, as the ConfigurationService is much "smarter" than the old ConfigurationManager.  The string will already be trimmed.  Additionally, the if just before this is unneeded, as you can pass in a default value if it's unspecified.  So, both the if and the trim() can be removed in favor of just calling
String shibURL = configurationService.getProperty("authentication-shibboleth.lazysession.loginurl", "/Shibboleth.sso/Login");
timeline.author: tdonohue

timeline.bodyText: @atarix83  What would happen if the Base URL includes a port number?  While it's less frequently seen, I have seen sites that run their DSpace on port 8080, for example.  It looks to me like Utils.getBaseUrl() would fail if the port is not either 80 (HTTP) or 443 (HTTPS)
